result.execSummary:
The defendant John R. Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with Count 2, but consecutive to prison sentence.

Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations, to include any AODA or drug abuse compliance.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John R. Nelson in court (in custody) with attorney Thomas W. Johnson. 
James H Fassbender appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Statements by counsel. 
Victim statements by Michelle Bennett and Mark Bennett. 
Statements by ADA Fassbender. 
Statements by Atty Johnson. 
Statements by defendant. 
15CM132 - The Court sentences the defendant to 90 days jail, concurrent with sentence now being served, and to pay all costs. 
15CM195 - Sentence withheld, ordered 2 years probation concurrent each count, but consecutive to prison sentence. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs/supervision fees 
- pay restitution and surcharge (Bennetts to be paid 1st) 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations, including AODA or drug abuse compliance 
- no contact directly/indirectly with Mark and Michelle Bennett 
Appeal rights were provided.

Order for Delivery of Prisoner
Affidavit for Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum

Defendant John R. Nelson in court (in custody) with attorney Thomas W. Johnson. 
James H Fassbender appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Defendant advised of rights, waives rights and enters no contest plea to sole count in 15CM132 and counts 1 & 2 in 15CM195. 
Per ADA Fassbender, State has completed witness responsibilities. 
Court accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty of sole count in 15CM132 and counts 1 & 2 in 15CM195. 
All other remaining counts are dismissed and read in. 
Bonds continued. 
SEH 2/23/16 2:45 pm Br. I.
